I prefer to use the Brewing System for hot water and go the old fashion route using packets of hot chocolate... it's cheaper and better!

Too strong I like strong coffee, I like 8 oc. French Roast, wish I could find it in a K cup. This coffee was so highly rated that I bought it. I can't drink it, it's strong and bitter. Anyone know something that tastes like 8 oc? Carolyna
Portions too big! Great Kellogg's cereal, all our favorites, but the portions per cup are way too big for any of us - we'd do better with about half the size.
not my style haven't received any compliments, and just doesn't work for me. I prefer the new bottle of Gucci I just bought.

It works a little.... I must admit that I was anxious to try this. Sure sounded interesting because as we all know, sometimes an encounter can leave you feeling very unfulfilled... The first time I tried the product, I just kept applying it until I felt something. It took ~5 drops. Ok, so I learned that it takes a few (10 +/- minutes to feel the sensation it causes). Then it took a shower and a half-hour or so to completely wear off. The sensation it gives is like cinnamon oil....not a tingle, and for me, didn't heighten overall sensitivity at all. Because it is to be applied ONLY externally (clitoris) and not other places, it depends on what you like.... The second time I used this product, I ended up applying three drops. This makes the product rather pricey because this container only holds about 20 drops... I can't highly recommend it, and I probably won't buy this again, but it was a fun experiment.

Chalk in a Can I realize that protein powders never usually taste like anything, but this stuff is horrible! Smells like strawberry, tastes like chalk. I can put 2 whole bananas in my shake, and it still tastes bad. I normally drink one upon waking, and within 1-2 hours, I am sick to my stomach. I found that eating with my shake was the only way to avoid this. On the other hand, this powder mixes well, and it does smell good. SMELL good. I find that 3 scoops in 10 oz of milk mixes well enough, if only it would taste like something. I will go back to Labrada, at least chocolate tastes like chocolate with them. Oh, and good luck finding the scooper. Mine is always in the bottom of the can.
DO NOT WANT Both my cats say "DO NOT WANT" when I give them this flavor. They love the Newman's Turkey & Veg though.
Clapper Plus This item burned up when I tried to use it. I threw $24.50, plus S & H. away!

Awkward, But Better Than Nothing While the flavor is good and keeps breath fresh as well as a lozenge does, the brush is not easy to handle (it is so small) and there is no bristle height to be effective. The pick does not get completely between teeth, as it is too thick. The foil packaging is difficult to open.
NOODLES COME OUT HARD Good taste, but I had to cook the noodles 5 min longer to get them even close to an edible softness.

Great Taste Concept but Too Bitter as K-Cup I love using the K-Cup for hot or iced tea, so I was excited by this flavor. But, I hardly use it, since even on the lowest temp setting, this comes out way too bitter. Besides that, I like the light balance of flavor otherwise. It just isn't enjoyable with the bitterness.

TASTES LIKE BEANS Like all bob's red mill mixes this tastes strongly of beans. The cake looked great and unlike most GF mixes this bag made a two layer cake, lovely, but the smell of the batter and the taste of the finished cake was AWFUL. We could not get past the bean-flavor. Very disappointing, I can not believe all the good reviews for this product!
nothing special I was not impressed with this purchase. It smelled delicious when brewing, bu the taste was flat

I love extra bold, but not this one! I love bold/extra bold k-cups, but unlike some other choices this one was intense, bitter, and far too strong for my palate. I'm really surprised I didn't like this one since I have yet to find an extra bold k-cup that I didn't like. Some other choices I enjoy, in case you also found this way too strong: Timothy's World Coffee Rainforest Extra Bold Espresso K-Cups for Keurig Brewers (Pack of 50) Green Mountain Coffee Fair Trade Organic Espresso Blend (Extra Bold), K-cups For Keurig Brewers, 24-count, Boxes (Pack of 2) Green Mountain Coffee Dark Magic (Extra Bold), K-cups For Keurig Brewers, 24-count, Boxes (Pack of 2) Newman's Own Organics Special Blend (Extra Bold), K-cups For Keurig Brewers, 24-count, Boxes (Pack of 2)
Strong after taste Product was delivered on time and promised. However, we didn't care for the taste of the chocolate shake. The vanilla is much more palatable.
Too limp Even when I use only a pea size amount of this conditioner, it makes my hair limp and flat. Not for me. It does smell good though!
Too dry This bar was a little to dry and too hard, not to mention on the bland tasting side too.

Tastes okay I guess, odd flavor/texture Besides the color and texture which was so off-putting that I almost couldn't make myself try it, they were edible..at first. Their nutritional value isn't that great: ~Way too high of fat (18g as it stated on BAR, 16g stated on website) ~High Carbs (30) ~Too much sugar (10g) ~Little vitamin value/low fiber ~the only redeeming quality is 9g of protein. These bars are slimy and thick textured like pulverized grass mixed with oil. They are very oily. After the first one I couldn't make myself eat another so that was it for me. I won't repurchase or buy any other flavor.

I don't want to complain, but... I bought this cereal recently. The flakes are good-they don't get too soggy. The chocolate, not so good. It left a thick waxy coating on the roof of my mouth. I didn't think the taste was bad overall, just didn't like the waxy feeling. I will finish the box, but I doubt I'll buy it again. I guess that's what I get for trying to eat chocolate for breakfast!

These are Terrific! I did love these brush heads at first, but after time, not so much. Takes less time to brush my teeth but does not thoroughly clean, especially the back and in between. Price is rather steep too...would be nice if the "razor blade theory" company would stop raping consumers!

Not for heavy leakers with big breasts I tried both the Johnson's and Lansinoh disposable pads, and I definitely prefer the Lansinoh. Here is why: - the Johnson's are smaller, but thicker. I have large breasts, and they just about cover my areolae. When they shift (and they do, I tend to toss and turn at night), they'll easily slide off the nipple. Result: soaked bed. The sticky part isn't very sticky. Neither is Lansinoh's, but at least they're big enough so that the nipple is still covered, even if they do slide. -The Johnson's don't wick away the moisture very well. I've leaked through them at night, but part of the edge was still dry. I've only leaked through the Lansinoh's when the pad was completely saturated, and they may look thinner, but they can take up a lot more than the Johnson's can. -With the Johnson's, the side that is not supposed to stick sometimes sticks to my nipple! This happens during the day, when I'm not leaking. Annoying, especially if your nipples are already sensitive and recovering from cracks. Overall, I think they might do the job and even be comfortable if you have smaller breasts and less leakage than I do, but for me they're not doing the trick.
Best International Coffee Flavor This is the best flavor of the Sugar-free,caffeine free International Coffee. It is a great treat.

Opt for the Pro-X or Regenerist Line ... Procter and Gamble has always been honest about their Olay line: it doesn't provide surgical results and it doesn't even take the place of a visit to the dermatologist ... but it does allow for small, positive changes. Though this product is inexpensive, I agree with the opinion of some other reviewers ... it's a little gimmicky. You would be better off to invest in the Olay Anti-Aging Starter Protocol Pro-X Kit which is a bit more intensive and offers better results. This will make your skin softer, but there were no other noticeable results (for me). (But I also do not smoke, do not drink, have a strict diet, and wear SPF every day ... someone who needs genuine repair may see other results). My personal opinion is that instead of experimenting with the product du jour, men/women interested in skincare should book an appointment with the dermatologist and get a professional opinion. My dermatologist customizes programs for her clients' specific needs ... you simply cannot do this in the aisles of Wal-Mart. The bad part is that the expense doesn't stop here. You'll probably be given a prescription for Renova (which is about $200.00) and be told to invest in a moisturizer (about $15.00-$35.00) and an SPF lotion/foundation (price varies). So, if you are always experimenting with the newest product and dropping $30 here, $40 there ... then just see a dermatologist. If you do not expect significant results and will be pleased with small changes, then try some of the Pro-X or Regenerist products. Bottom line: While Olay's Skin Rehab isn't going to inspire drastic changes, it will leave your skin feeling softer. The price is appealing, but there are only two weeks worth of product included.

Still Too Heavy for Fine Hair I have fine, naturally curly hair that tends to frizz on the sides. I've tried many products for curly hair and often find that they either leave my hair too crunchy or they are just too heavy for fine hair. I wanted to like Bb Curl Conscious, but it really didn't do anything but make my curls heavy and too soft to hold a style, and did nothing to smooth out the frizz. So I'm going to pass on this one. BUT... My hairdresser recommended Moroccan Oil Curling Creme and that is what I use now. It controls the frizz better than anything I've used so far, and the argan oil actually adds body to my hair and my curls look *pretty* not just curly. It also smells fabulous without competing with my perfume.

Smell vanishes within an hour This was my husband's favorite cologne for years and they have somehow changed the formula and it lasts about 30 minutes. I bought here on amazon thinking maybe it would be different as the last I bought was at Neiman Marcus. Same holds true for the women's Angel. VERY disappointing.

A touch odd I can't get enthusiastic about these. They didn't taste exactly like brownies, and both my husband and I had stomach problems with them. We were not gorging on them, either. They lasted 4 days. Doubt that I will order these again. (never say never!)

Bad reaction I had a bad reaction to this product, I noticed right away that my arm pits were itching, I didn't put it togeather right away so three days later after sweating a bit it had become really bad. I went to the bathroom and washed off and the skin came off the underside of my armpit, and it burned badly. I didn't get a rash, but it felt like I had been rubbed with acid, it was bad, I threw the stick away. I have used the Polo Blue stick of similar make with no issues, as well the Yves St. Lauren stick was fine. I attempted to inspect the label and see if I could find anything but I have never had a reaction to anything else like this before, so watch out! I gave it 2 stars because it smelled good, but damn.

Pooh Designs Stained Babies Clothes! I tried these a two years ago with my daughter and hated them because they stained our onsies. I thought I would try them again (hoping they had improved)with our baby boy and am very disappointed again. I'm kind of a clean freak and the brownish orange stains on the onsies are really dingy looking. We ran out of onsies a few weeks ago and put him to bed with just the sleeper over his diaper and it is RUINED! I have soaked it for days in Oxi Clean washed it eight times and is still not coming out. As far as leaks go they don't work overnight.

Chaotic Clapper This model proved to be erratic, responding to incidental room noises sometimes, but at other times ignoring distinctive claps. It does provide some entertainment value, but can be disruptive at night and at other times simply annoying. The sensitivity control seems operative, but doesn't make the operation any more predictable.

INCONSISTENT Great to Horrible! I reviewed this licorice several months ago and gave it 5 stars. I deleted that old review because of extreme inconsistencies in this product. When it is good it is beyond 5 stars. I loved it so much I even preferred it over RJ's. I had a case a month auto delivered to get the discount. For several months it was the perfect licorice but the last case I received last week was HORRIBLE!!! It seriously tasted just like the smell of Preparation-H ointment! I wrote to the company to tell them about this and gave them the control numbers off the case. I am trying to get a refund from Amazon as well. Until they get this quality control issue fixed I am going back to RJ's. While RJ's tends to be very inconsistent in texture from firm to very soft, the flavor has always been close to the same. I still like Darrell Lea better when it is well, normal. The Line No. on the case was 07-938 Exp. Jan. 27 2010, if that helps. Licorice must be very difficult to make, guess thats why there are no recipes out there at all!

lemon flavor flavor lacking ... tried all cup sizes but found the flavor very weak. I added additional lemon juice to the bottom of my cup prior to making the hot drink.probably will not order this item again(2 boxes is a lot of not so good lemon drink)

Only ONE use?! I purchased this product at a PureBeauty store before reading all the reviews on it (it came recomended from a store employee because it "smelled better than most dry shampoos."). It did work great the ONE time I was used it. After that use it seemed like there was still a lot of product in the can, but when I went to use it again a week later there was nothing left at all. Terribly disappointing and frustrating. And unfortunately when I brought it back to PureBeauty and complained about it they simply said they don't accept any returns on empty products. Argh!!! Simply put: don't buy this unless you want that one use is worth $18.95 to you. That's the last time I'm buying from Tigi!

Mixed Feelings This is an attractive machine, looks good in my kitchen. My husband and I use different coffees and love the convenience of having whatever brew we need available, cup by cup. It's easy to operate, the coffee smells good and tastes good. Having said that, here's the downside. It's not very well made. It has been recalled for some electrical difficulty that could have been disastrous and the replacement broke down within months. I am now on my fourth or fifth one and if this one goes bad in the next two years or so I am going shopping for another brand. Sometimes I think I keep buying them just because it's so fast, efficient and pleasant to deal with Amazon.
Not very tastey I am sure the product is good for you-- but I did not find this good tasting at all. I was expecting a "typical" fruit leather... this had much less taste and a worse texture.

weak cappuccino This is the first Douwe Egberts coffee product I am not satisfied with. It has a nice froth but it is very weak. I like coffee that has a strong coffee essence but this pod offers only a weak coffee flavor. What I had to do for a good coffee taste was to add a half teaspoon of instant coffee to the cup before starting the brew cycle. These pods need to be improved before I will buy them again.

Bitter to the End Silly me, thought with the name it would at least have the aroma of kahlua coffee. Far from that. This coffee is extremely bitter, doesn't taste like kahlua or have the aroma. Somewhat strong. Sroma of arabic beans. Won't buy again.

Skip the Body Gel... I was pretty disappointed by this product. I love the fragrance (I already had the perfume), but this gel dries into the skin instantly , and doesn't moisturize at all, and the fragrance fades within about a half hour. I probably should have gone for the lotion or body cream. Live and learn :-/
not so good just not a good tea; too much peppermint,not enough tea flavor for me. should have saved my money on this one.

Doesn't lather well and left hair feeling dry. I feel like I need to use a lot of this product to get it to lather even a little bit. After one washing with it, I feel like my hair is still dirty. The other reviewers made it sound like it was more of a moisturizing shampoo, which is what I was looking for, and much to my disappointment, it doesn't seem to be. The one plus, it smells very nice. Just wish it performed better.

chemical overload The hospital used these (Swaddlers Sensitive) on our newborn, and the nifty yellow-blue line that indicates wet or dry feature was great for us new parents. They proved hard to find in stores, however, and it was a few months before we found them again on Amazon. Excited as we were, out of the box, we noticed a distinct odor that was more chemical than baby powder. As time went on, it became clear that the odor was not just strong, it also caused our baby to rub her eyes, squirm when wearing them, and generally resist the diaper altogether. We too became somewhat overpowered and repelled by the scent. I'm a few too many diapers into the box to feel like I can justifiably return them, but I would do so, if only to send the message to Proctor & Gamble. These have made me rethink cloth diapers as a better way. If you have a dead nose, they work brilliantly at keeping baby dry (hence the 2 stars). But I feel that in this case, the odor could well be attributed to something less than healthy. So use with caution.

Anything more than a small cup is just brown water I drink Coffee People Donut Shop just about every morning because it tastes like what I think morning coffee should taste like. Maybe I don't have a refined enough palate for this, but to me it has such a mild taste that I might as well start my day with tea. Not that anything is wrong with tea (when I can't get coffee) but when I drink coffee I want to taste coffee not the "subtle hint of citrus", or "berry tones". If you like coffee skip it. If you take notes when you taste things this may be for you.

squeak squeak squeak I bought these in hopes of extending the life of my New Balance 993 shoes. The inserts were a perfect fit for my extra-wide shoes and, after some adjusting, they became fairly stationary (though they do move around more than the factory insoles.) Comfort was fine- about the same as the factory insoles. Based on their current wear levels after 6 weeks, I'd expect them to last at least several months- comparable to the factory insoles. The problem with these insoles is that they've developed a bit of a squeak. As I walk down the hall, every step on my left heal results in a pronounced squeak. It's funny and embarrassing at the same time. Because of this squeak and how quickly it developed, I have to recommend that you not buy this product unless you plan to change them out every 4 weeks or so.
Nothing different I have been using this for about 3 months now, but I don't really see any differences.

Not What I Expected I was very disappointed in the taste of this item. Not at all what I expected from Splenda. It is much too overpowering, strong and when added to your beverage, that is all you can taste. For instance, if added to coffee, you will not detect ANY coffee flavor, only the Splenda flavor. Much too strong. I prefer the subtle taste of the other coffee additives over this Splenda product - without question!!

If it stings and burn throw it in the trash Age:23 Skin Type: brown skin, moderately oily in the summer. When I was a teen(age:17), I used this product and it miraculously cleared up my acne and pimple with in two weeks with no dryness, redness, or burning like proactive, which I have also tried. Now that I am an adult(age:23) I have begun to get really stressful(unbalance hormones) and developed some really extreme acne, from nodules(large hard pumps under skin) to pustules(an inflamed whitehead). I thought eh what the heck, if it worked in the past it will work now. Was I regrettably wrong. The first time I tried it again, my face was burning and red, but I thought to myself it was just my skin getting used to the Bp(benzoyl peroxide) and I was desperate. The burning subsided after a few days, but then my skin started to get flaky mainly in the ares when I'd applied the bp lotion. I was happy that it calmed down the bumps, but after a day, more bumps and whiteheads were appearing in the healed area due to irritation. I told myself it was the purging period. It was the longest purging period ever--3 weeks. I was depressed, I didn't even wanted to go out anymore, and even when I did, I try not to make eye contact and just look down the whole time. After a month and a half of using this product I still have some minor nodules and a few white heads, but worse of all I have these reddish-brown unhealed dark spot cause by Bp( did my research)--I hope it isn't permanent darkspots. My conclusion for this product is that the ingredients changed. I have compared the old regime to the new regime and the old regime feels more safe on the skin then the new ones. And Bp is toxic for your skin, specifically my skin. Now I am trying to find a more natural alternative like tea tree oil cleanser,alcohol free toner, etc.. and you don't need a moisturizer when your cleanser and toner are natural(safe) and doesn't leave your skin dry. Hope this review help and good luck with the battle against acne.

Back to the drawing board I just received them today and since it's made by Colgate I'm disappointed in their design. I use EVERY variation of Colgate Total and Tom's of Maine toothpastes. Normally I use an electric toothbrush, but when traveling to somewhere where luggage can get lost I use an Oral B soft toothbrush and keep one of those crummy hard bristled folding travel toothbrushes in my purse. I thought this item would be PERFECT, but alas it's not. While I love the idea and that they are individually wrapped and disposable (I know not very green) I would not use them again. If the manufacturer's designers are reading, here are my suggestions to regain my use of this product: lengthen the handle by an inch but keep same style and diameter; USE SOFT BRISTLES (a lot of us already have sensitive teeth due to gum recession); use a slightly dehydrated bead/blob of Colgate Total Whitening toothpaste (knowing that as Americans we will be expectorating no matter which "waterless" cleaning agent you use) so provide the type you already know your customers like to use; lastly make wintergreen flavor available. This creation has the potential to be a very hot product if those few modifications were considered and implemented.

Love the cereal... don't buy from Amazon I bought the Kashi GOLEAN cereal from Amazon because I couldn't find it at my local grocery store the last time I went... I really like the cereal, it was the packaging for shipping that is getting the bad review: The boxes were all taped together with packing tape, and the tape ran accross the top of all of the boxes, rendering the resealable closing tab on the top of the box useless, as it basically had to be ripped off to get the tape off of the top of the boxes. The same thing happened along the sides, now I have 6 boxes of Kashi with half of the box ripped and destroyed, including the nutrition facts on the side.

Not bad could be better Saw this product online, looked over the reviews seemed favorable. I found this product to be extremely sweet; its main ingredient is sugar, it states that right on the label. I wish was able to read the ingredients before I purchased this product. I do not recommend this product to anyone who is trying to cut back on sugar in his or her diet.

Smells funny... The cologne I purchased was at a GREAT price, but when I received it, I notices that it smelled different than it does in retail stores. I thought it was just me, but every time I spray it on, it smells awful...

Dried Out My Skin I have used this product for a little over two weeks and so far the results have been terrible. I did the entire system and followed the directions exactly yet after every wash my skin was dried out and stripped of it natural oils. I now have dry patches on my cheeks and chin and I still have acne on my forhead. I tought maybe it was the acne control lotiona that was the problem so I reduced my usage but the cleanser is just as bad, after washing my face and putting on moisturizer the dry patches did not subside. Do NOT waste your money, I am a young African American female with combination skin so I suggest for people in the same boat as I am to look elsewhere.

Yuck... I have long hair and had high hopes for a miracle when I bought this product. I was looking for something that would smooth out my crazy frizzies and make my hair look more sleek. Maybe it's just me, but I followed the instructions on the bottle and something went very wrong. My hair became sticky and I could barely pull my brush through without extreme pain. The lotion did make my hair a little less frizzy, but I was expecting dramatic results for product that is popular and much more costly than other brands. I used up quite a bit of the product trying to acheive the results that were advertised. Unfortunately it never happened. It may work on different types of hair though.

Usually very good Their spice tea is usually very good and fresh, however, my most recent shipment is probably not very fresh. In a previous shipment of teabags, I noticed that each teabag would quickly flavor a cup and a half of tea, whereas in the shipment I recently received, a bag will barely flavor one cup, and by the time it is well flavored, the tea is cold.

I've come around... My boyfriend loves this perfume so I picked some up. At first I didn't like it, at all, but I've come around. I wear it for him because he's so crazy about it and I haven't found anything else he likes as much. SO I've gotten used to it. We've decided it smells like Jolly Ranchers, possibly watermelon. I may have to buy some Jolly Ranchers to confirm this. Sugary sweet undertones. At first it seemed to last forever but now that I'm used to it I realize it does fade from almost overpowering to barely noticeable within an hour or two. Either way he compares himself to Pepe Le Pew when I wear it so it's well worth it. I like Lavanila Vanila Coconut, Lollia Wish, Flores de Iles Floral Sensual, Burberry Brit and Angel for comparison sake.

Poor delivery I love Balance bars and eat them all the time.. I saw that I could order them here for a slight discount and did... However, they arrived melted!!! I couldn't believe it and don't recommend ordering them for this reason! What a waste.

Cleaning power not quite there Not as effective at cleaning dried on food as the "non-environmental" types....but usually OK if you rinse before putting dishes in the dishwasher. Was hoping it would be more powerful, but it seems to get that, you need those harsher ingredients.
Swtiched back to pampers baby dry I tried this for my daughter when she started crawling, but it leaves residue (white diaper gel)

Very Bitter Tasting! I don't care for this particular flavor, as it's very bitter taste has forced me to add flavored creamers and plenty of sweetener to make it drinkable. I need to get through the two boxes, but no more after that.
VERY STRONG When the Coffee People say extra bold they mean it. For me personally the coffee was way too strong.

baby crackers made in china? I was really excited to order these crackers because my toddler liked them when a friend of mine gave her one, but I didn't realize that they were made in China. They dissolve really easily and are individually packaged, but come on now, do you really want to feed your child snacks that are made in China? It's up to you, but I know that I wouldn't have ordered it if I knew where it was made.
Good Earth Red tea Thought it would be interesting to try. Prefer the standard Good Earth Tea. A bit bity in taste for me.
Third Distillation Remember that this is third distillation ylang ylang. First distillation is far better (and far more expensive). Second distillation is better.
Not an everyday coffee This is a very strong coffee, not what we prefer as a regular coffee, but it would be nice every once in awhile.

Too much like medicine I truly looked forward to trying this product but I could not tolerate the taste. The first piece ended up in the garbage. It tasted so much like a medication I had to spit it out. I did give it to some friends to try and they said that at first it tasted like Flintstones chewable vitamins. Then they found a spot that tasted like alfalfa. Very "green pasture" tasting. I guess it's all in what you like but I didn't like it at all.

Unique Flavor, 140 calories, Dubious Nutritional Value This drink has a unique flavor: closest resemblance I can give is coconut water with pineapple juice. Personally, neither me nor my son, liked the taste. Each 11 oz drink Tetra Pak has 140 calories! Although they claim health benefits for upset stomach, sore throat, acne, eczema and fortification of immune system, I could not easily find any scientific studies to support those claims for this drink or cashew juice. Added sugar cane is not healthy; and you will flush those added vitamins down the toilet, anyway, if you consume healthy diet. O.N.E. juices are produced in Brazil and they claim that their Tetra Paks are environmentally friendly. It is also very confusing as to how to sip it. There is an opening for a straw but is not accompnied by one; of course, plastic straws are not eco-friendly. Sipping directly from the container is not easy. After water, the most healthy drink is vegetable juice. Fruit juices have lot of calories but many provide unique nutritious ingredients and anti-oxidants- pomegranate, blue berry, mango, carrot etc. I usually dilute fruit juices with club soda, often 1 part juice with 2 parts club soda. I got this drink as a part of Amazon Vine program and would not buy it personally.

Seems different I used to LOVE this Bill Blass fragrance that I used about 28 years ago. It has been difficult to find over the years. I have to admit that I was disappointed in the bottle I recieved last month. I do not know if it really is somewhat different or if my memory of it is not accurate, but it does smell different to me.

Not worth it This has an artificial-sweetener aftertaste. It also seems to have an alcohol-like flavor, as if I am adding an alcohol based axtract instead of something made with water. I have yet to try my strawberry and orange of the same brand, but the chocolate is definitely not worth trying to save money by purchasing this brand (go for sweetleaf, it doesn't taste like a 'diet' sweetener).

Like drinking a vitamin The taste of this product is awful. It does perk you up a little bit. It's like drinking a liquid vitamin with lots of grit. I will not buy again. I have had for 2 months approx. and only used two of them. The rest are sitting in my cupboard.

amazon box contains less than what you can get elsewhere Pay careful attention to the number of diappers included in this value box! It is smaller than the normal box you usually get from other stores or from amazon, thus the price is not really cheap. I purchased the No 3 Cruisers value box from amazon twice, one box came with 160 diapers, and one came with 116 diapers
A bit chalky I like many of Pamelas gluten free products but this one is not as tasty as her mini chocolate chip cookie or her ginger cookies. I would give it a 2.5 if I could.

Changed the formula! Just read the review about the change of ownership! Now I know why my new 33.8 supply of Hydrate shampoo has changed from the last and is no longer great. Scent is missing; shampoo is thicker and lighter in color, and it leaves my hair too soft, limp and difficult to manage. Never again will I buy this product! Why do large corporations always ruin a good thing?

No comparison to Coffee Peoples Donut Shop k-cups This blend is way to weak. To me it tastes watered down and just can't satisfy that first cup of coffee fix I need in the morning. Coffee peoples Donut Shop does the trick and really is a lot more reminiscent of the old time doughnut shop coffee places. Even Timothy's breakfast blend coffee is better than this.

a friend's review This was a gift for a friend. To protect the identity of her wrinkles, the friend shall remain nameless. When I asked about how she liked the "roller", she was not particular enthused. The biggest complaint that she had is the application of the roller. According to my friend, she felt the need to "press the roller down really hard to get anything out". Given the sensitive nature of application site, she reported she would rather use a traditional cream or serum by hand, rather than "poking her eyes with a glue stick". I asked her if the thing at least worked in the "anti-aging" department. She retorted with a "what do you think?". Luckily, I choked back on the immediate response of "looks the same to me" and commented on her youthful complexion. I would say this product is a bust. Too much trouble for very little gain.
Salad Dressing The salad dressing, itself is fine. The delivery was late. I am a prime member. This took seven days to get to me. Will not order again.
So-so flavor I wasn't a huge fan of this cereal. It is not as sweet as other Special K cereal. I think it does have a good proportion of protein though. I would not buy again.
Not too thrilling. Looks thrilling though!With white shiny swirlling ribbons of "eye treatment" that doesn't do anything but put micro-glitter under yours eyes for lighting effect.
ordered wrong glo! I meant to order Miami Glo instead of this one. I love!!!the scent of Miami Glo. Regular Glo gets just two stars from me. Too Flowerey for my taste!

Kids didn't like the consistency/taste My 4 year old ate 1/2 of one and refused to eat another. My 2 year old would eat an occasional one. I tried them and they have that strong vitamin taste. They might not be full of fillers but if I can't get the kids to eat them, it wasn't worth it for me.

You can spend less and get better results I don't know where Olay is going, but the ProX line doesn't do anything more than all of the other 75+ products Olay puts out, except make your wallet more empty. I've bought $5 products that hide your lines better than this. Save your money Ladies, and if so, Gents. You can get 2 for $20 at Applebee's!

Not Cold on Arrival This product was not cold on arrival like advertized--"with ice packs." This product must be kept cold or it loses it's effectiveness. It also took more days to arrive to my home than advertized. I'm very disappointed.

Weak After using French Vanilla creamer in other coffees, I made the jump to French Vanilla coffee. What a mistake. Definitely not the same. Not even close. This coffee is weak and the french vanilla flavor is barely noticeable to me. Ended up pitching the rest and going with that amazing Italian Blend, also by Timothy's.
evaporates too fast for the cost This works as advertised but evaporates much too fast for the price. If it cost half as much, I would give this five stars. It smells so clean and fresh.

Not great The Hot and Spicy Beef Jerky was pretty gross in my opinion. There was a funky, unidentifiable, taste in there which was not natural and I could not get past. Now, I have had World Kitchens Original, Peppered, and Teriyaki and they are all very good. Not sure what happened with this one but stick to the other flavors and you will not be disappointed.
May be good for you, but kinda gross The flavor just wasn't hitting with this product. I'm sure it's at least healthy though. Maybe this will float some's boats out there, but not mine.

Gloria Jean's hot chocolate for Keurig Very watered down, have to add 1 1/2 spoons of another hot chocolate to make it drinkable. Doesn't matter what setting we use on the Keurig, just not hot chocolate. Its hot water that has a chocolate flavor. I won't order this brand again.

disappointed Maybe it's just me, but I can hardly detect this fragrance when I spray it on. Thinking it's just my chemical makeup I sprayed it several times on a tissue but still detected very little scent. Has anyone else had this problem? I use a number of other fragrances and have never had this happen. Perhaps I received a defective bottle. I do love the pretty daisies on top!

Are your contacts giving you problems? Maybe it's the Opti-Free! I have worn contacts for almost 20 years with no problems and have always been very thorough in my cleaning regime. I've been through permanent lenses, monthly disposables and weekly disposables and they've always lasted for the proper duration. Right now I wear Acuvue Oasis which I found to be very comfortable and which are designed to be replaced every 2 weeks. Over the past year, however, I've been finding that more often than not they will gunk up with a cloudy slime well before the 2 weeks is up, sometimes after only a couple of days of wear. Worse still, the gunk is often impossible to clean off even though I use a good cleaning fluid and protein removing drops. It seems that no amount of rubbing and rinsing will suffice. Amazingly, I never considered that it might be Opti-Free Replenish that was the culprit because I always thought of it as an excellent solution and it was recommended to me both by my optician and online reviews as a good choice to use with Acuvue Oasis. However, it's just recently dawned on me that the gunk-from-hell might be a product of an allergic reaction to Replenish. So I've switched to Renu Sensitive Eyes, which is NOT a "no rub" solution and does NOT contain inbuilt protein removal (I rub with a cleaning fluid and provide my own protein removal) - and hey presto, my lenses are lasting the full 2 weeks again. No gunk! I have no idea what my eyes were reacting to but I have a hunch that it may have been either the no-rub ingredient or the protein removing ingredient. So if you're having problems with your eyes or your lenses and you use Replenish, make sure you try another solution to see if it's the culprit! It seems that people are having more problems with this solution than most others on the market. Also, I have not noticed any reduction in moisture or comfort after switching to Renu, which means I wasn't really getting much benefit from the moisturizers in Replenish anyway, which was pretty much the whole point in using that solution.
Like Sonicare better I have both the Sonicare and Oral-B Pulsonic tooth brushes and like the Sonicare much better. The Sonicare brush feels like it's more effective at cleaning below the gums. - Mark

I agree with the previous reviewer, the name is deceptive. When one purchases a product that is called Newman's Organics, one would expect organic food. Not just the vegetables, which are much less expensive to be organic than the meat or chicken. I was very, very disappointed to find out that the chicken is not organic. For a couple of dollars more, just buy real organic dog food. This dog food isn't exactly cheap, so you expect that they will provide what they are advertising. This whole "greenwashing" thing needs to be regulated better. If someone uses the word organic in their description, it better be organic. Otherwise the consumer is being deceived which is unfortunate. Newmans has a great reputation, I buy a lot of their products, but this was intentionally deceptive and it makes me reconsider buying anything from them in the future. On the positive side, my dog loved it, she would lick the bowl around the room for 20 minutes after the last morsel was consumed. I have no idea what they put in it that tasted so good, it's like the crack cocaine of dog food. She has never been a finicky eater, she'll pretty much eat anything voraciously, but this stuff really rocked her epicurean world. Too bad she isn't getting any more of it.

As of 12/09 this is NOT Gluten-Free I contacted Bob's Red Mill by telephone after noticing that the packaging no longer shows Gluten Free. I was told the buckwheat is sourced from one company, and that enough contamination has started occuring that Bob's Red Mill Creamy Buckwheat can NO LONGER be considered Gluten-Free. The non-GF status is also listed in capital letters on Bob's Red Mill website. Very disappointing to me because I had grown to really appreciate the taste of this cereal--even more so than oatmeal.
honey roasted macademias I love macademias and I've ordered this same product directly from Mauna Loa previously. These seemed a bit stale, so next time I'll order from Mauna Loa's website.

Love the product - price is ridiculous! I buy this product every week at Target. I like it better than even Starbucks! However, I pay less than $7 per pack (it goes on sale every 6 weeks). Even at Macy's, Bed, Bath, & Beyond, and the Tassimo website it is still $9.99! I normally consider Amazon.com as having extremely good prices - but in this case, a rip-off! Go somewhere else to buy this product...

Very weak Based on the reviews here, I had high hopes for this coffee. I realize it's a mild coffee, but it is really lacking taste and just seems very watery. I tried making a smaller cup, which did help a little, but I'm still disappointed. I won't be purchasing this one again. I wonder if this is typical of Gevalia t-discs, cause I was disappointed in the Gevalia Capp as well (the Maxwell House is WAY better).

review This product did supress my appetite quite a few times. It mostly helped when I would go to resturants or eat fast food. I found that I became fuller faster than usual. On a day to day basis it did help only a little bit. I eat very healthy to begin with and exercise 6 times a week. This product did not help with my weight loss nor did I feel like it gave me any added energy.

Not quite as good as I recall. I first tried Royall Bay Rhum about 40 years ago when I bought a bottle in the USVI. I really enjoyed its understated scent which I guess one could call "manly". Perhaps it's just my memory, but I seem to recall the scent being quite a bit stronger and certainly a lot longer lasting. I still like the scent but find myself using it a lot more liberally than I do most colognes. By the way, I consider this to be more of an after shave than a cologne. While it's not the most expensive cologne/after shave I've ever used, I think that it's expensive enough that it should be longer lasting or at least a lot stronger. As it is, I think that it's been cut with a lot of alcohol to stretch the more expensive ingredients. To put it bluntly, I find this product overpriced. I'll probably use Bay Rhum again but it will not be Royall.

Review of Prevagen for memory loss I have just completed 30 days of Prevagen and have thus emptied the bottle. I am sorry to say that the product was completely and utterly ineffective. So ineffective I cannot even remember the reasons why I was persuaded that it would work. My short term memory is just as bad if not worse than when I started. I did not expect that it would cure my memory problem completely but I did expect some good benefit. Consequently, I'm really disapointed. There was no way to rate this item on your scale but from my review it should be obvious. I'm not sure why Amazon says I rate it a 2. I hope either the product or my review helps someone else. \

Poor Conditioner I've tried many conditioners over the years. I thought the Terax Crema would be something special based on all the glowing reviews and company claims. I found none to be true. My hair actually started to become poorly textured and somewhat tangly while using this conditioner. It barely conditions. It certainly doesn't improve hair texture or condition. It smells nice- that's about the only positive thing that I can say about it. Many better conditioners out there, cheap and pricey.

Poor customer service My container arrived with not one, but BOTH, of the tabs on the top lid broken off (and therefore almost impossible to open). Considering that it would be almost as much $$ to ship it back to amazon as the product cost, I instead tried to contact the company to request a new lid. They said that they'd send me one, but instead sent me a new freezer thing. When I tried to contact them about their error, they never responded. By the time I was done waiting for them, it was too late to return to amazon.
Not What I Ordered The coffee pods I received were not "Breakfast Blend", just generic "100% Arabica". Further, these coffee pods do NOT work in Senseo coffee makers!
Sour and tough These are okay, but tasted fairly sour and were tough to bite into. The strawberry and raspberry were significantly sweeter and softer.
waste of money After using this conditioner, (which was not cheap!), my hair was frizzy and unruly with no shine. Don't waste your money - Pantene from the drug store works much better.

clumps for hot chocolate Very disappointed! I love my Keurig machine but for hot chocolate, it's a big no! The water doesn't mix the hot chocolate very well so you have most of the chocolate left in the kcup. You can cut the foil and get to the mix but what a pain! Will not order this again.

Eh... I really didn't like this scent. It smells pretty cheap and the only reason I still have it is because of the price I paid for it! I highly recommend considering another fragrance such as any brand from Bulgari. My personal favorite is Dolce & Gabbana's The One--you won't be disappointed!

Cheap, but you get what you pay for Compared to a higher quality battery (eg duracell) these batteries seem to last half as long. If you need cheap batteries that last like the ones for sale at the dollar store, this is your battery.

Terrible I really like lip balm pots, so I decided to give this one a try. The smell was so terrible that I ended throwing this lip balm away. Everytime I applied it to my lips, the horrible scent penetrated my nostrils, lol. I will never buy this particular product again. They have one that comes in a blue pot and I might give that one a try. I don't see how anyone could have gave this a positive review. It might be a good lip balm but the smell was nauseating.
sadly... BUYER BEWARE: This is NOT edible baby parts. It is ACTUAL food. How disappointing...

Poor charge, must've gotten a bad batch With all the positive reviews, I must've just gotten unlucky on a bad batch of the white wrapper version. I'm getting 1800-2100 mAh on all four of my batteries even after 2 full Refresh cycles on my LaCrosse charger. This is obviously well below the stated "minimum 2500 mAh" on the batteries. I love Sanyo normally and I'll continue to buy their Eneloop series, but as of October 5, there's at least a small chance of receiving a bad batch of these batteries.

This stuff killed my stomach I ran out of my TwinLabs Creatine Mono about a week ago, and decided to try this version, which has more supplements added to it, instead of reordering the 'plain' creatine. I've taken Creatine several times, and never experienced the bloat that other have complained about - until now. The bloat I've had for the last 5 days on this stuff is awful, and no matter how much water I drink, juice I take it with, or food I eat with it, the gas is unbearable. My flat stomach is temporarily gone and I have been spending way too much time in the bathroom. I have not been able to get a good ab work out in because of the discomfort (I usually work them really hard, but have not been able to push it as far on this stuff). I am taking the reccomended dosage, so it's not a matter of taking too much of it. I realize that this may not happen to everyone, but this stuff does not work well for me. I'll be switching to a different brand.

Puffy eyes + Metal rollers = OUCH! This looks like a great idea. You massage your puffy eyes with the little roller balls and the puffiness goes away. Unfortunately, for me, it didn't work that way. You click on the end a couple of times until the product comes out and then massage your eyes. OK, so I try the right eye first, massaging the puffiness under it. After about 5 seconds, the eye is darker and sore. Well, maybe I rubbed too hard??? So I try the left eye, rubbing extremely gently. No go, the left eye gets sore after 5 seconds as well. No reduction in puffiness for either eye. So I try the next day. This time I put the product on my finger and apply it that way. It's a nice light goo that absorbs in a couple of minutes. Still no reduction in pufffiness. It says to rub all around the eyes, so I massage the crows feet. That's better, but they don't lighten up at all. The rollerballs do not dispense the product evenly and some gets in my eye at this point. It stings. It must be good for something. So I massage my eyebrows into place. Feels good. Doesn't hold them for more than a minute, but it feels good. Then I get wild, I rub the pen on my forehead. Ahh... that would be great for a tension headache. After about 15 seconds of gentle rubbing, my forehead is red. The fine lines are still there. This product did nothing for me, but I gave it 2 stars for the forehead massage.

Probably Not Worth Trying? Love the White Mountain Hot Chocolate, but I wanted to try something different and while the flavor wasn't horrible, bad it was a bit too sweet and watered down so you lose the heat of the chocolate you're looking for to begin with. Overall the White Mountain is much better. The worst thing though was of all the K-Cups I've used this is the only one that dripped (and not just the occasional cup, many of the two boxes I used) when I would removed it from the Keurig, creating a nice counter mess. Not happy with this result. It could just have been a bad batch, though since I wasn't happy enough with the flavor I won't be trying this product again to find out.
Need larger nostrils than mine for the neti pot to work It probably works fine, but I my nostrils were too small to get it to work. I went back to using a bulb syringe.
Tastes Great BUT This pasta tastes great, but it made my blood sugar rise as much as any other pasta. Don't know why it affects some people differently.

Offensive smell and not appealing to kids While I personally love and eat tons of organic and natural foods, I have to say the $30 I spent on this case of cookies was a waster. Neither of my children will eat them, nor will I. They have a smell that once you get in your nose hinders any attempt at enjoying the very small bit of flavor they have. Nature's Path makes great cereal and energy bars but fall short with these cookies. Stick with the chocolate or peanut butter and you are okay. The honey grahams will sit in your cupboard until trash day.

Gloria Jean's K-cup Variety Pack The variety is nice, but the flavors and aromas are so weak that you don't even realize that you are drinking 'flavored' coffee....no less coffee. I prefer a medium roast coffee, but these do not even come close. The only way that I would recommend this coffee is if someone prefers a very, very weak cup of coffee. Green Mountain, Newman's Own, and Timothy's brands are much better coffees. As for how many K-cups were actually in the box, I didn't count them.

Whats the point? I bought these for my daughter to potty train her. Well she did do very well all day, but at the end had a little accident. The pee went straight through her undies to the floor. Didn't absorb a thing. If you want to buy underwear for your little one as opposed to pull-ups just get the cheap ones with no padding, trust me it absorbs the same. I expected more...

caught in the norelco web I have buying norelco refills on amazon for a long time (old version) but the current one is overpriced and is a ripoff considering the price at target. It is also used up way faster than advertised.

I really wanted to like them but... We know a lot about gluten free products in my house, and we've tried a lot of GF cookies. I really wanted to like these but I've had many better products before. I was turned off by the texture and the taste.
Great vitamins, not so great taste These are very good vitamins from a good company, but the taste needs some work. Even my very UN-picky 10yo says they are nasty and my 3yo refuses to take them.

Tastes terrible I wanted to like this, I really did, but it tastes EXACTLY like if you were to spit up in your mouth --- acidic. Very weird cheese taste. Same goes for all Annie's pasta, it's too acidic. Tastes like you're eating vomit. I've tried adding butter, it helps, but it still tastes pretty bad and artificial.....it tastes chemical.

It's a tube of jelly. I did not like this product. You might as well eat regular jelly, because that's what it is, a tube of jelly. It's not very tasty and the texture is not a good texture for a snack. I love their fruit leather though.

Taste like vomit Tastes like sick chemicals. I cannot imagine any child eating this and liking it, same goes with all of Annie's mac and cheese products. Sauce is thin, noodles are too small, and it tastes like vomit or stomach acid (I'm serious). Kraft now makes Organic mac and cheese and it's DELICIOUS, I'm eating some right now.
Soggy Gets WAYYYYYY too soggy, WAYYY too quickly. Taste is okay, but I didn't eat more than 1 bowl of it.
Disappointed This product is drier and less flavorful than I had expected. Ended up using them on cereal, rather than as a stand-alone snack. Could have just bought cereal with dehydrated berries.

Despite what O.N.E. claims, I still prefer orange juice. According to O.N.E., this juice is less acidic than orange juice. After trying it, I must say that my impression is the contrary. Also, this product tastes as if it's artificially sweetened, despite the benign-looking ingredient list. And - just for those curious - no, this drink does NOT have any bit of "cashew nut" favor. All in all, it is a decent drink but certainly not tempting enough for me to buy it in the future.
Passable snack With a list of ingredients like this, it is hard to believe that this is only passable. The chocolate is underwhelming, the tartness of the agave is overwhelming.

Didn't work for me...... My two kids went through an entire bottle and I didn't notice ANY change in their symptoms. For the price, I probably would not buy it again. Great that it's safe and natural but it didn't do anything for us. I also tried the adult tablets and felt no change in my symptoms.

high sugar snack These taste good, but are a bit too sweet. The sweetness level reminds me of Rice Krispie treats. Keep in mind they have 7 g of sugar and just 1 g of protein. There really isn't much nutrition in these bars... 110 virtually empty calories.

Cute packaging but awful taste I tried these based on the reviews and the taste was awful. I am a cappuccino lover and make them daily with stumptown coffee and or peets and thought I would try these. I ended up selling the rest in my garage sale this past weekend for 2 dollars. Maybe I would have better luck with the dark roast.

Moist Cardboard I ordered both the banana nut + the oatmeal raisin and would return both if Amazon would let me. There is utterly no taste to these other than a foul aftertaste. Consistency of moist cardboard. For 290 calories, I'd rather have something with some sort of flavor.

An Energy Boost But a Bad Taste Yes, I could tell that this product did give an energy boost, much like a cup of coffee caffeine boost, but the taste is just like trying to chew up a children's chewable vitamin. I thought it might just be me with a problem with the taste, so I gave a couple of the chews to my husband and told them they were chewy candy, like Starbursts. He popped a couple in his mouth, made a terrible face and said "Yuck". It's not that it is really bad, it just is not a pleasant taste. They are very sweet but with a lingering vitamin flavor left in the mouth, so I would not buy these again. Like I said, the energy boost thing is really there(at least it seemed to work), but I just couldn't get past the taste.

Not one of my favorites I have seen people either liking it a lot or not at all. I am probably in the second lot. I bought it after reading a lot of good reviews. I was impressed by the packaging also. But that was that. The fragrance is too lemony and it some how felt like vegetable oil with lot of lemon juice. In winter still I could stand it, but in summer it was horrible.
do all of these give you gas??? I really have used Roma but I notice the worst and smelliest gas ever after drinking this stuff has anyone else experienced this??

Not much flavor, and kind of waxy I usually love all things cashew and agave, but this bar was a let down. I bought it because all the peanut butter bars are no where to be found due to contamination scares. The one good thing about the bar is that it's not very sweet. Otherwise, I wouldn't get these again. Of the ingredients: Cashew, Date, Agave Nectar, Almond, Amaranth, Sprouted Flax. (Certified Organic, I was only able to taste the flax and amaranth. It didn't have almond flavor or cashew flavor. Raw is supposed to be better, and most of the raw things I've tried have tasted fantastic. This wasn't the case with this bar.

Not to expectations When I ordered the flavored sweetener I had high hopes for a great product but this Splenda French Vanilla Flavor Blend falls short, especially in black coffee. I have tried it sprinkled on fresh popcorn which is a much better use than in coffee. Looking forward to other uses.

good idea but.... Hormel has came up with another shelf stable product. Of course to make it last over a year on the shelf it has to have lots of preservitive ingredients. I sampled one and found they are very salty and tastless. I bought these thinking they would sell in my little store (I sell mostly to senior citizens) being convienant for Senior Citizens to prepare a quick dinner. I was wrong. They are still on the shelf, and I will probably wind up trying to get rid of them at a loss or give away.

We love soy milk but this product is simply not tasty I bought this product expecting to use it during camping trips, but no one in my family of four could tolerate its flavor. I ended up buying individual aseptic packages of soy milk instead.

Bitter, even with sweetner and creamer I was not impressed with any of the included flavors in this variety pack. They were all surprisingly bitter. Additionally, I really can't make out the flavors. Visiting friends tried a few of them and went right back to our other non-Gloria Jean's flavors with a polite, "I didn't care for them." I would not purchase these again.
Weak coffee with an ok taste The coffee itself tastes ok, but is weak and doesn't pack the punch I'd expect from "Extra Bold"

Big price, small change... I'll keep this sweet and short. Over the course of applying it around my eyes for about a week, there was little change. Only a few very fine lines seem to have disappeared but not enough to be noticed by anyone. I have really sensitive skin, so I was happy that it didn't break me out in a horrible rash. The ball bearings that are on the tip stay cool as you roll/massage the anti-aging lotion in, which might be the only useful thing about this product (a cool ball bearing massage). For the price, totally not worth it. The .2 (a fifth of an ounce) of lotion for nearly $20... just crazy! Pros: Feels good on your skin. Won't break you out (at least I didn't). Cons: Very small amount in the roller tube. Crazy expensive, can't justify the cost for as little the results were/are.

The recipe clearly has way too little liquid I was excited to try the pre-made cornbread mix. However, when I made it using the recipe on the back of the packaging, there seemed to be WAY too little liquid. I could barely get them into the muffin pan, and then they just held their shape (didn't spread into the pan). It seemed to have a decent taste, aside from being dry. So I tried it again using a different recipe, and substituting the mix for the flour in the other recipe. That didn't work perfectly either. I have had much better results just doing it with a recipe and cornmeal.

Caramel nut? I, like a few reviews I read after getting it, agree it doesn't taste like caramel vanilla nut. It sort of tastes like ameretto to me or smelled like it, I forget which exactly. I had to add a caramel flavored creamer to it to make it taste more like caramel. I usually hide my coffee's, so no one else uses them all, but I couldn't get anyone to drink more than one pod of this. So I had to muscle through the bulk of these 48 pods myself. It wasn't my fancy, but that doesn't mean you won't like it. Chances are not in your favor IMHO.
Tobacco like I don't have like it and I don't recommend to anyone. You wear this for a date with a non-smoker female you will regret it.
Did not notice any difference I took most of the bottle and did not notice any difference when taking this product. Would not order again. Since we are different your experience may be different.
not as effective as some I've used The area that traps the moths is quite small and I don't believe it attracts the moths as well as others I have used.

What are the REAL ingredients On the main page this item says it has .9 (that's point 9) grams of fat. Then open the nutrition info and it says 11gm of fat. Whats real? BIG difference! Are the other numbers screwed up also??? Makes you wonder.

Great for the Environment...but just okay for your dishes Over the last few years I have become increasingly concerned about my impact on the environment. I use compact fluorescent light bulbs, recycle at least half my trash, try not to drive very much, and buy eco-friendly products. This is one of the products I have purchased to replace Cascade Complete Gel Lemon Burst - 45 Oz, 12 Ea which I had been using for the last 15 years. I really assumed this would be an equal, or close to equal, trade considering the higher price... no such luck, unfortunately. I found that this cleaner left food stains on the dishes and silverware, which I normally was able to clean with Cascade. I also found that harsher stains such as coffee rings in mugs were left untouched after even two washes. I have recently started pre-scrubbing all the dishes and the silverware before washing. This resolves almost all of the problems, but at a cost. If you were unable to scrub dishes, due to arthritis or didn't have time due to a busy schedule, then this would be really annoying. Plus for those of us that use multiple washes to counter the ineffectiveness, the impact on the environment may be neutralized since we would be wasting more water, more electricity, more gel, etc. If you have a high efficiency dishwasher and don't mind supplying some essential elbow grease, then I would say this product does help the environment and can eventually clean your dishes. On the other hand if you are looking for a great automatic dishwasher gel, then keep looking. This product ranks similar to the cheapest watered-down generics lurking in the sale aisle of a dollar store. Nothing against this product's intentions, I commend them. But, its performance left my dishes wondering when Cascade was coming back.

gave me indigestion I like the taste of flax seed and often use ground flax seed in my recipes, but now I know that flax seed oil is completely different. It tasted fine, but even when using mixed with food, it gave me awful indigestion. After two tries, I couldn't bring myself to try again. Fortunately, I had purchased it (via Amazon) from Swanson, and they stood my their money-back guarantee.
Compass doesn't work The compass does not seem to work. I didn't open the plastic case. I just turned the case in a few different directions and the compass would not point correctly.
Peach Tea We found very little peach flavor in this "peach tea". It is a poor substitute for Twinings.

Disappointed I have used this product for quite some time and always purchased it at department stores. When I saw it on Amazon for half the usual price I quickly ordered it. However, when I used it for the first time it did not smell like the product I had been getting and the aroma was weak. I will not purchase it here again.
Hardly pops This must have been old even though it was not outdated. My cheapie brand pops better than this. Otherwise, it tastes good. I won't buy it again since I only get half the bag to pop.

TOO WEAK OF A SCENT! DISAPPOINTED BY LACOSTE THIS FRAGRANCE WAS PURCHASED BY ME AND FOR MYSELF TO USE, HOWEVER THIS SPECIFIC LACOSTE RED FRAGRANCE LET ME DOWN DRASTICALLY. I AM A FAN OF THE FIRST ORIGINAL LACOSTE GRAY SINCE IT WAS FIRST SPRAYED ONTO MY SKIN. THE SMELL PLUS THE LASTING EFFECT WAS SUPERB! BUT THE LACOSTE RED COLOGNE WAS A TOTAL LET DOWN BECAUSE ALTHOUGH HAD A GREAT SCENT, THE LAST EFFECT WAS MAYBE 25-30 MINUTES IF SPRAYED WITH A HIGH AMOUNT. THIS LACOSTE RED DID NOT STAY ON ME FOR LONG AT ALL. THANK YOU FOR READING MY REVIEW.

Not that effective, but a great hand cream This is wonderful as a hand cream, but as a face cream, I'm not impressed. It does moisturize nicely, but I haven't seen evidence it's doing anything else. I'll be using this for my hands and switching back to Alpha-Hydrox from here on out.

Not one of Timothy's Best I found this to be one of Timothy's least flavorful coffees. As mentioned by other reviewers, the pumpkin flavor was slight. I also found that it had a 'watered-down' coffee flavor...and I did make it in the 'small' cup option. German Chocolate Cake is my favorite so far and Winter Carnival is a close second.
too heavy on the skin it is not absorbed by the skin and by the end of the day it becomes a dusty film over the skin.
Better than the Dark Roast but Still Weak This is almost drinkable. It is way too weak and semi bitter to be called espresso coffee. Try the Millstone or if you can find it the Target brand pods.
Bleah... Compared to Balance bars and Luna Bars, these are very cardboard tasting and bland. Only way resemble strawberry is that they contain some red goo..

Fusion Power blades cost more, work worse Hey guys, I originally bought a Fusion power when it came out and used it for a week - I decided I didn't like it as much as my M3 Power and put it aside. The blades felt like they were scraping too closely against my skin and I found it to be an overall fairly uncomfortable shaving experience, without getting noticeably closer than the M3 Power. A year or so later, my M3 Power stopped working, so I ran out to the store and picked up some normal Fusion replacement cartridges (not Fusion Power!) instead of buying a new razor altogether. The experience was completely different from what I remembered! The razor just glided over my skin, I never felt like I had to go back over areas, it was incredibly comfortable, and, most importantly, an extremely close shave! Surprised, I wondered what it could be, and realized that it might be the blades making the difference. I picked up some Fusion Power replacements and tried them side by side and it confirmed for me - the Fusion Power blades are markedly worse than the regular Fusion blades. Don't believe me? Give it a shot yourself, I think you'll find that the best combo is to buy a Fusion Power razor and regular Fusion blades. Good luck!

Not so much I much prefer other brands. This one seemed bitter no matter how I brewed it. Judging by the other reviews I may have a different taste in Chai than most, or maybe I just got a bad box of tea.

Beware of breakage during shipment Glutino crackers are among our favorite GF crackers, but if you have a store in your area that sells them, that might be a better bet. About half of our crackers (in all 6 boxes) arrived broken.

Warning, Contains High Fructose Corn Syrup This was my favorite cereal for years...until I read the label. I guess I took for granted the ingredients because of the commercials and advertising of it as such a healthy cereal and even promoted it as a diet plan to lose weight. I hope the manufacturers realize how many people discontinued purchasing this great product after educating themselves on the dangers of high fructose corn syrup. They need to reconfigure their ingredients list to actually make something that won't be eventually blacklisted for being harmful to unsuspecting consumers.

Limited usefulness...better option available... Basically a mini toothbrush with a blue alien fish egg in the middle filled with minty freshness. The opposite end has a flexible point that serves like a toothpick while overall it's about as long as my middle finger Here are the problems: 1) I Could not open the package until I spotted the pull tab. They should really make this more obvious. Even then, you have to fish the thing out, a two handed job. Could the packaging be bigger and waste more plastic please? They're packaged two in one blister so with this much space I could actually store a travel toothbrush and a travel toothpaste! 2) They say that you don't need a sink or water, but my experience was that after I was done using it, you have enough saliva from the minty capsule that you really want some place to spit and rinse. You also have to be careful about how you hold it when using it, otherwise you end up with saliva on your hands. Now you show up to your meeting with fresh breath....and sticky hands... 3) Brush is way too small (smaller than my pinky nail) so it takes a while to get good coverage - oh yeah, also those bristles are STIFF. 4) Iffy ergonomics - it's small, remember? Oh, now it's covered with your spit, so kind of slippery too. There's a groove to help prevent it rotating in your fingers but it does take some coordination and attention to use properly. Forget about using it while driving. If you try to use this after a late night at the bar - you'll probably drop it on the floor, and that puddle isn't beer. 5) This product wastes a reasonable amount of plastic with each use. Of course this might be a positive if you are an environazi hatin' SUV driver and want to freshen up after eating your BK double cheeseburger with beef from clear cut rainforest...;) After using this four times I decided the only advantage this has is that it's smaller (not by much) than the smallest travel toothbrushes and you don't have to carry around any toothpaste - you can also use those without a sink if you have a kleenex to spit into. Instead, I recommend the Oral B Brush-Ups. Oral B Brush-ups, Textured Teeth Wipes, 12 wipes These are textured sleeves which fit over your finger, impregnated with minty freshness. They are so small you can keep them in your wallet next to other foil covered things you might need if your breath is fresh enough. They are much easier to open (one handed, while driving, speaking from experience) and easier to use (slip it over your finger and then rub your teeth, gums, etc) Use it while driving, jogging, bungee-jumping, or playing tennis. If you've found this review to be helpful, please let me know!

Pampers Swaddlers Vs. Huggies Snugglers I have three boys (4, 2, and 3 months) and so I can tell you my favorite diapers for them (I don't know about how they fit for little girls!) I have always loved Pampers Swaddlers for sizes N, 1, 2 but I had a coupon for these and tried them out. I am only somewhat happy with them (and these are supposed to be their premium diapers, right?!). In the the last week I have gotten peed on many times (even when the diaper isn't that full) and they're just not as soft or cut as nicely as the Swaddlers. I love the regular Huggies when they get to size 3 but for new little guys these didn't cut it for me. I won't be buying them again. And for people looking for a good overnight diaper you don't have to double up you can get Huggies Overnites Diapers or Pampers Baby Dry Overnight Extra Protection Diapers--tried both and they're great (once the kids are sleeping through the night!)
Product Came in Damaged Box Product came in a damaged box. This wasn't mentioned in the product description. Expiry dates are ok.

Pretty bad I've found that most Glutino products taste quite good. However, I was very disappointed in the breakfast bars. I tried the apple and the blueberry. They both have kind of a bitter taste and you can hardly taste the fruit. They are edible but not very enjoyable. Some folks might feel differently about the taste but, if I were you, I would try one box from a health food store, before I ordered boxes and boxes of them from Amazon.

It's NOT a pack of 3!!! I needed this product (it is a great product) and the local store stopped carrying it. I was happy to find it online and very excited when it was advertised as a pack of 3 for the price. However, when I received it, there was only one tube. Disappointing!

Smells Like the City Thats what it claims and it's true. It smells like you just got off of a motorcycle. I suppose that's sexy for men, and maybe some women, too. I prefer something more feminine. I LOVE the other Bvlgari women's scents.

Could live without it. This works through static electrity, however you can use a old undershirt. Wash the shirt and use it forever or buy these things and make the landfills larger. Instead of removing every item off the counter you can quickly remove visual dust but your not really cleaning anything with this.

transfat cookies I was very diappointed to find there were trans fats in these cookies. Ginger is one of my favorite flavors - however not trans fats. I would not buy them again until the trans fats are removed.

Percolator Coffee filters Great idea, but very difficult to use, especially when you have arthritis in your hands as I do. They tear very easily when adding coffee. They do make the coffee taste better and alot less grounds in the coffee.
TOO BIG! I wish the bottle would have picture of real size pill! Surprize! Open and try to swallow! Good luck!

Too thick for a lot of people. I use floss regularly. I bought this hoping this will last more number of weeks than the little packs. This floss is very thick. Me, my wife, and kids all have trouble getting it b/w teeth. It has to be pushed hard to get in between teeth. When we do it hurts as it pushes teeth apart (yes it is very thick).

Go fish I was trying to find a fish oil supplement for my kids. We tried the chewable gummy fish by L'il Critter and my son and daughter hated them. So I decided to buy something you can mix in food. I made sure they did not know it was fish oil and had them taste it. My son's first comment was, "It tastes like the bass spray Daddy uses on his fishing lures." Of course he has never tasted the bass spray, but has smelled it when his dad used it. Bass spray is pretty much made of fish oil. So, I think there is no hiding the fishy taste for some people. I tried mixing a 1/2 tsp. in a whole smoothie and it was terrible I couldn't even drink it. I will try mixing it in something else, but so far we think it tastes quite fishy.

Won't use it again I didn't see much changes after 7 days. It bleached my gum and peeled the gum between my two front teeth, and it also irritated my tongue. However, all this discomfort were bearable. I am not going to buy it again because it didn't bleach my teeth much. I had a lot of foam and saliva during the treatment, so I am not sure if that is the reason the outcome wasn't so good. I used Colgate whitening gel before, and it didn't work either. Therefore, I decide that I am going to let dentist bleach my teeth next time. Hopefully, I would have better luck. Use it before you brush your teeth will reduce the irritation to your gum and teeth. I could go for 45 minutes when I used it before I brushed my teeth.

Not quite the miracle we were expecting... After reading the reviews on Amazon and researching food ideas online I got some friends together and we all divulged. Out of the seven of us who took it, three of us just felt sick after the process. All of us concluded that while our taste buds were playing tricks on us, they were not necessarily good tricks. I wouldn't say sour things tasted sweet for instance, I would say they tasted weird kind of like lychees but not very good ones. The only thing I tried that really improved after dissolving the pill on my tongue was a Coors light. It tasted like a pretty good Pilsner after the pill, and everyone seemed to like this, but sometimes a nice cold Coors light is just what you need, so... If you have nothing left to spend your money on, this isn't the worst choice in the world, but don't expect a miracle, because that is not going to happen. Expect a stomach ache, a loss of appetite, and then you won't find disappointment.

Kinda rough..... It's a great price, especially with the super saver discount but they just aren't working for us. Like someone else said, the rolls run out very quickly. There are only 2 of us using the rolls and we have to replace the roll every 3 days or so. It's also a little too rough for me. I prefer softer tissue like Charmin. Good for the budget though!
overdone a little over cooked. not as nice as plain. good flavor but too brown . could use a little more salt too

Feels like I'm washing my face with lotion. Try Aveeno instead. This consistency of this product is not what I expected for a supposed facial cleanser. It feels like I'm washing my face with lotion. It does not leave my face feeling clean. In fact, it left a slight residue which aggravated my combination skin. I ended up having to wash it off with soap. So far I haven't found anything that comes close to Aveeno Active Naturals Ultra-Calming Foaming Cleanser, Fragrance-Free, 6-Ounce Bottle (Pack of 3), which leaves my skin feeling clean and soothed without causing dryness or irritation.

My dog LOVES this treat also,and had horrible Diarrhea I'm so glad I read these reviews.My dog LOVES these treats also,and I just bought another bag yesterday,but sometimes he does get diarrhea,not always,and now I know why.Also,sometimes when you open a bag it smells alfuw.I want to thank everyone who wrote these reviews.I'm giving you all a helpfull vote.

Does not taste good at ALL :( I bought a number of healthy "snack" bars. This one was nasty. It was so bad that I considered spitting out the bite I ate. The "flavor" (there isn't much of one) is disgusting, and the texture is not good either. I have had an actual brownie made with whey protein from a shop nearby, and it was quite good. The Think Thin (brownie crunch) does not taste like brownies, does not have a crunch, and will make you thin because you'll rather not eat than eat it. Yuck! (I'm giving it 2 stars because it is supposedly healthy, so if you can choke it down, you at least have that going for you)

sent the wrong grind the company sent me whole bean instead of fine grind but when i called to complain they gave me my money back and i got to keep the product so everything was okay there. its okay too because illy is the best espresso.
the button does not work as the butoon does not work its waste of money for me investing on this perfume...
Hard to Swallow I enjoy the taste of hemp seeds and hemp oil, but in a protein shake the flavor is unpleasant. When mixed with water, it's almost impossible to get down.

Another skincare product that does not work I bought this product when it came out in what I believe was February of 2009 and used it for about 2 1/2 months with not one result.
