I have sun spots and put this cream on religiously every day and saw no change. Retin-A seems to be the only way, you just have to get used to it at first. Don't waste your money...........

Multiple Keurig Coffee Taster The idea of a Kahlua flavored coffee was quite enticing. I like Kahlua and even bake with it. This coffee, while not horrible, was simply bad. I am so sorry that I have two cartons of it. I can't give it away fast enough, although I do warn my friends that I do not like it. While I did not detect an offending smell, there was a pronounced bitter aftertaste.

Initial taste good but flavor does not last Got this product after reading that xylitol gum chewing might help with a jaw problem I have been having. This gum tastes really good at first but loses flavor really quickly. If they could find a way to make the flavor last, it would be a winner. If you want longer flavor, you will have to try another gum with flavor extenders.

Was disappointed....... I was so disappointed in this coffee. It seemed to leave a bitter aftertaste that lasted all day..... i tried various ways to make it taste better, and brewed it in a brand new coffee maker, but nothing changed that after taste.... The Folgers Breakfast Blend is MUCH better, and more smooth tasting.

Not so great These were on sale at Shop Rite for $6.99 (12 pack) so I thought I'd give them a try. It looked very watery in the cup and also tasted watery. I prefer a rich, creamy hot cocoa and this was far from it. It also has a fake sugar aftertaste which I did not care for. I don't think I'll be buying these k-cups again.
pop corn taste great but if your using an air popper not so great the little seeds will fall out before popping.

Stick with Gu or Clif Shots I'm not sure if it's the flavor or the brand, but I don't like the taste of this. It has a very artificial flavor. I've never had any issues with Gu or Clif Shots, so I'd stick with those if I were to buy again.
Don't like these They are coated with an awful feeling lubricant. Don't buy these. Durex Extra Sensitive are way better than these.
Foil wears out fast Foil wears out fast. Buying replacement foils for this razor every four months or so has me thinking of switching to another brand.

Towles Leave Particles Behind (Title Misleading Too) I would not buy this product again. The title is misleading; these do not qualify as "Mega" sided rolls. The size is actually what I would call "normal." The "Choose-A-Size" sheets are very small which is actually a plus since you can select the size you would like. However the deal breaker is that the towels break apart and leave small paper particles behind on anything that's not glass.

Too dry for me I love Olay brand and have been using Olay products. However, compare with other Olay moisturizers, this UV moisturizer is too dry for me. I could see my skin even show some dry lines in the afternoon. So every time I have to use it together with some moisturizing lotion. Don't think I will buy it any more.

Its ok for short term use I bought this product to replace my original battery for my LG VX8600. I would not recommend buying or using this replacement battery for longer than a 60 day period. Although this battery came newly wrapped, it quickly lost its ability to retain charge after 2 weeks of normal use. It barely holds out any better than my old battery (needs to be recharged roughly every 12 hours). I received an extra Verizon battery thru an exchange on Craigslist, and even though this battery is over 12 months old, it works much better like the original battery (I have used it for about 1 month now and I have had no problems). I would suggest getting this replacement battery only if you are looking for a temporary short term fix until you get a new or used Verizon battery.

Too heavy for oily skin I have sensitive skin, but it is also oily. This product left my skin feeling heavy and sticky. I also live in southern TX where the humidity is extremely high. I don't plan to use this product again.

Taste like Play-Do! These taste exactly like Play-Do! It's actually pretty amazing. I don't think they could capture that exact taste again even if they tried. I love all the other Fruitified Zone Perfect Bars (especially the Banana Nut!), but I would only recommend this particular flavor if you are feeling reminiscent of your childhood days.

Wide variation in quality Twice in the last couple of years I've ordered the Double Bergamot tea in the bulk package of six boxes. I've found a wide discrepancy in the amount of bergamot in the tea from box to box. Often there seemed to be none at all in the tea bags. Since I had several boxes on hand, and they were not old or stored improperly, my conclusion is that the quality control of this particular tea is not good. The Holiday Chai did not have this problem, and was consistently good.
too weak for the morning. This coffee should not be called breakfast blend. I was expecting a stong rubust pick me up cup. Instead it was completly opposite. Very week.

Perhaps a bit bitter in flavor Taste is ultimately, of course, subjective. Nonetheless, I find this brew to be bitter in its initial tasting. It hits the front of the mouth with an initial bitterness, and the other flavors do not present themselves strongly enough to overcome that first impression. I should note that I have made five cups on consecutive mornings, so it is something endemic to the brew. I do not use cream/sugar, and those who do may find the bitterness ameliorated, and the underlying boldness of this selection should carry through such additions.

It just gave me a stomach ache! My joints creak a bit with middle age, and I get stiff sitting too long or even walking a far piece. This stuff would be great if it helped the joint inflammation, even a little. I followed directions, only had one a day to start with meals, and I see why. This stuff burns down there in the gut you can seriously feel the flame. Now, I like to give it a fair chance, but especially when I went to two a days, and after about half the bottle was used up, I felt no benefits. So why I want to give myself psuedo-indigestion twice a day would be beyond me. Hotwings lovers, Thai food fans, spicey food fellows of all races and creeds, this may be for you. I'm a dyed in the wool spice hater who will shy away from all things spicey anyway. This may not be a fair review from that regard, but I see no health benefits from this stuff, at least in the short term. Unless you salivate when you hear the phrase "buffalo wings", I doubt the non-hot fan will tolerate pain in the tummy long enough to realize any long-term benefits.

not as good as the Giant brand Thought I'd try this since it was similar in price to our regular coffee. Don't like the taste much, it tastes like fake flavoring. The grounds are very fine and it makes it darker and more dense - not in a good way like Starbucks coffee. I end up having to use more cream. We went back to our regular brand at Giant since we grind it fresh and a little more coarse.
Disappointed Although it arrived ahead of schedule, the product itself is disappointing. It does not last long after sprayed. I've been buying "Passion" for years and have never had this problem.

A great scent if you like bug spray I don't usually rate perfumes because I really think it's a matter of taste. But this scent is very unelegant It smells like ocean and citrus which is great, but the ocean smells a little toxic, and the citrus smells over-ripe. Smells an elevetor after an overly made-up old lady exits. Not recommended.

Don't spend the money This product does not whiten like I expected and the trays are awkward and not maliable enough to conform correctly to your teeth. Also, the gel doesn't hit every spot so the tops of my teeth aren't the same color as the base. And when you're done with it it leaves big chunks of gel in your mouth that made me gag. I also had to search all over for how long to leave them in...it's not on the instruction insert but on the box in tiny little letters. Instead of these go with Crest Professional Whitestrips. You can't get them in stores--I could only find them online.

Vending machine coffee tastes better I can't say I'd recommend this coffee. If not for the convenience, I wouldn't ever have rebought it, but now I've found a better choice for regular coffee in the Tassimo - either Starbucks Breakfast Blend, or Jacobs Kronung. Both beat this coffee hands down in flavor. The Jacobs doesn't make as much coffee though. This coffee tastes like vending machine coffee at a highway rest stop - the kind from a machine that hasn't been tended to recently. Thin and yucky. Sorry, Gevalia fans. They make a good espresso, though, and the latte and cappuccino choices are much better. Pass on this one if you're not sure and try one of the others.

More Cookies than Nutrition The name of these "Nutri-Grain Cereal Bars" might lead one to believe they have some whole grain nutritional value. But when you read the packaging the only nutrition comes additives. There is no fiber to speak of and they are loaded with high fructose corn syrup. I use them when my blood sugar drops too low much as I would a piece of candy. These travel pretty well and do give you a bit of volume so you don't feel hungry but they are far from being a healthy food choice.
Weak Fragrance It takes a lot of product just to notice you have anything on. Best use for this is in an office environment, not the club.
not the cheepest I do research on diapers before I order them this last time I compared luvs to huggies and depending on what size you need the luvs are the better buy

not authentic I purchased two bottles of exactly the same product, the bottle was about $21. The fragrance was not authentic for sure, since the person who is using it has been a long-term user. We always purchased it from department stores before. So in this case there is no bargain, the fragrance is slightly different, and it wears out very quickly, and you get what you pay for. ...and this is the rub, it is impossible to return, since it is alcohol, amazon considers it a flammable item, and thus dangerous. hope this helps. T

Cat loves food, but subscription service is unreliable. All five of the Fancy Feast subscriptions I signed up for have been unreliable. Im October, I signed up for delivery every two months and received shipments only in October and December (it's now March 18, but I canceled all of my subscriptions yesterday). What was supposed to be 48-can cases Amazon turned into 24-can cases, with one flavor being canceled entirely. I was notified by Amazon that shipments would be sent in mi-February, but they never arrived.
Trouble with the sprayer I like the smell of this fragrance very much but have trouble with the sprayer mister. Maybe i just have a defective one but I need to unscrew the top and dab it on.

Shrinkage and oily residue I used this product with a vintage, off-white, wool cardigan I wear quite a bit. The sweater wasn't noticeably dirty or smelly, but I wear it so often I figured it could use a cleaning. It game out with a definite "newness. The wool has a renewed fluffiness, it's noticeably cleaner and smelling fresh. However, it was also noticeably smaller. It's still wearable, but being tall, the cuffs are riding uncomfortably high on my wrists now. Handling it also leaves an oily residue on my hands. I haven't read reports of this anywhere else, so I thought I'd let people know. It's not subtle either. Just brushing against it with my hand leaves some kind of oil. Oily chemicals. Yuck...

not as good as Slim Fast High Protien I tried this as a cheaper alternative to Slim Fast High Protien powder. I did not like the taste at all and Slim Fast has more minerals and a bit more protien. Pay a little extra and get the Slim Fast.

Sugar in the Jerky Short and Sweet: this jerky is quite sweet, compared to commercial jerky. In a one ounce portion, there are seven (7) grams of carbohydrates. For those on a low-carb diet, that is a significant amount. I notice that in the more "natural" jerkies, they tend to use more sugar. Perhaps it helps the texture and make the jerky a little less likely to dry out. It does show this on the label, which Amazon makes available, so don't make the same mistake I did and buy impulsively. If you are trying to find a beef jerky without preservatives, and from animals raised without antibiotics, etc, then this product is acceptable, if a little sweet. But if you are on a high protein diet, avoiding carbohydrates, then beware.

Too sludgy for my taste... This coffee was strong, but also bitter and coarse. It somehow gave me the impression I could CHEW it! Maybe that's Emeril's version of the New Orleans preference... but I do not recommend it. Here's a link to a good, smooth, strong coffee that I DO recommend: Timothy's World Coffee, Extra Bold Rainforest Espresso, K-Cups for Keurig Brewers, 24-Count Boxes (Pack of 2)

Another Brand is Better There was a pumpkin shortage in our local supermarkets, so I resorted to ordering this case online. Besides the fact that ten out of the twelve cans were dented, I used one can out of pure desperation. Yes, I was desperate for pumpkin. It's watery. It's not solid packed. And using the same ingredients I always do in the dish I used it, it was sub par. I have since sent the product back mainly because of the dented situation - otherwise, I probably would have given it to a food bank or something - they don't take dented cans either and rightfully so! Amazon took it back and I'm sure will be crediting my money. I WISH I HAD READ THE OTHER COMMENTS before I purchased this. Beware of dented cans.

Has no effect on anything Sorry to be blunt, but all this product does is spread a layer of sticky, shiny residue under your eyes, which is supposed to give the illusion of "smoothness." Unfortunately, if you rub or touch under your eyes at any point afterwards, the "smoothness" rubs off and collects in little residual pieces that get in your eyes and all over your face. Not pretty. It gets two stars for the ease of application. The roller is convenient and easy to use. But it doesn't make you look younger or less puffy.

Doesn't smell so good !!! I have tested this spray before but after owning it I really don't like it. There is a strong bad smell right when you put it on that gradually desolves but a little always stays. I like the other Polos much more

DECEPTIVE DESCRIPTION 160 WASHES ONLY FOR FRONT LOADERS I just received this product in the mail and am using it for the first time so I can't comment on the effectiveness as a detergent, but I do have to say that the Amazon description is deceptive. The descriptions says each box cleans 160 loads per box but this is only if you have a front loading washer. If you have a top loading washer, the box only cleans 80 loads which brings the cost per load up to 18 cents per wash (includes tax, no shipping) instead of 8 cents as originally calculated. Even when you enlarge the picture of the box on the site it is hard to read the fine print saying 80 loads for top loaders, 160 for front loaders. This product better be stellar otherwise I will switch to another product based on the cost.
Cheap. These brushes were cheap quality. They had a sort of smell that I did not like (like spray paint). I did notice shedding. I returned them for a refund.

Smells good... at first.... When I initially purchased this I really liked the smell, I would usually spray some for day events or dates do to the light not-so-strong scent. When making the purchase, I purchased the bundled version that contained the cologne (spray) bottle and the after shave (pour) bottle. Majority of the time I just used the after shave bottle, and occasionally the cologne bottle. All was well until roughly 8-9 months out. The scent from the cologne bottle now smells very rancid, I actually had to change clothes because it just didn't smell right. I thought maybe it was just me so I sniffed the after shave bottle to compare. Surely enough, they were both different in smell. Not only did the cologne bottle smell rancid, the aftershave (although didn't smell as rancid) did start to smell sorta acidic. Overall I am very disappointed with the products shelf life. I have had polo sports bottles from high school that lasted longer then this defective product. If this is your way for a cost reduction to raise gross margins, then Tsk Tsk on you Kenneth Cole.

Not the same as the prescription. At first I was surprised and happy to find this available online so I tried a bottle. At first, it appears to be the same as what was prescribed to me by my dermatologist. The one thing I did notice was that it was not as thick as the prescription version...then I read the label. Ingredients appear to be the same, but the first ingredient is WATER. So beware if you purchase this, it is probably a watered-down version of what you would get from the prescription version. I suspect it may or may not work for you depending on your skin condition.

Gas Station "Cappuccino" <a href="http://www.amazon.com/review/R3DHM1FVP57FC9"Watch Video Here: http://www.amazon.com/review/R3DHM1FVP57FC9</a I am more of an espresso/americano guy, but every now and then I really love a good cappuccino. This beverage tastes like the "Cappuccino" you would get out of a gas station machine or a vending machine. The milk has a slightly weird taste and it is sweetened! Why not let customers add sugar to taste rather than over sweeten the product? The drink is not strong or bold and as a little on the watery side when made according to the included instructions. It leaves you feeling really full and heavy not like a true cappuccino you would find in a local coffee shop. If you really want a cappuccino and have one of these machines, I think you'd be a lot better pulling an Espresso shot and adding your own fresh milk (yes, that does mean you'll need to froth it!). Note regarding video: the reason the saucer is cracked is due to bad product packaging for the Nescafe Dolce Gusto Machine. This is how it arrived to me.

Too Sweet, Too Watery, tastes like a gas station beverage <a href="http://www.amazon.com/review/R16NTOTEPGW8DK"Watch Video Here: http://www.amazon.com/review/R16NTOTEPGW8DK</a Trust me, I want to love this coffee. The machine is so easy to use/clean. But the coffee is watery, too sweet and just not very good. Take a look at the nutritional contents as well: 4g of Fat, 9g of Sugar, etc... Ouch... See video for demo/review.

Some of the muffin tops are good The brownies are not very good, one has pieces of pomegranate in it and the other just has an odd flavor and consistency. The muffin tops are good but you have to immediately freeze everything and then leave 1 out for awhile to get to room temp before you eat it.

Outright Bad I thought these bars would be a great way to grab breakfast and run... I was wrong. The Blueberry Yogurt bars are awful. Would recommend purchasing the oatmeal raison, they are much better...

Of course kids love it, it's full of "evaporated cane juice" The good news is that toddlers and older children LOVE this cereal, which some parents (seeking gluten free alternatives for their children) would be happy with. The bad news is that it is loaded with "evaporated cane juice" - also known as SUGAR. Calling it evaporated cane juicemay sound healthy, but it's just silly. This is a super sweet, super sugary cereal, and no matter how much my toddler likes it I will not give it to him ever again because of its high sugar content.

Bouncing Effect Nice product, and it works... but as soon as you stop using it.. you'll get a bouncing effect.. you will get back your loosen pounds back faster than you think. It works as long as you never stop using it.
Bitter These get worse with every bite. I even tried putting peanut butter on top to cover the taste. That didn't work. My five-year-old likes them. That is the only reason I didn't rate it lower.

Too sweet and not creamy. I love white chocolate so I was hoping that this would give me a creamy white mocha taste with my coffee. But boy, my hope was destroyed be it was way sweet and no creamy taste at all. Don't buy this if you're looking for creamy white mocha/chocolate taste.

Not great I think anyone into cologne or perfume has smelled this (assuming they haven't owned it) on at least a dozen others. Curve is the kind of scent you would expect to find littered around a college campus. Its a heavy synthetic smell, with a brutal starting point bubbling with artificial lavender and berry, and finishing to a warm but overbearing citrus and sandalwood base. Curve smells good if its applied extremely lightly, but this is never the case. The target audience would be young men ages 14-21. I bought my first bottle (the four ounce) when I was a freshman in high school, and I haven't been able to finish even half of the bottle through the years. Prospective buyers should definitely give it a test run.

No go. This tastes like someone left the cereal box open...for tooo long. It's on the stale side, though it smells great. Too bad I purchased 6 bags. I DO enjoy the Banana Granola though, its excellent.

Poor quality defeats purpose The idea behind this product is sound, and when you can get the blamed cap on securely it works, but that isn't often. The cap and the top of the pot are threaded, but getting the threads to engage is an exercise in futility. After enough fiddling, you can get the top on somewhat well, but by that time the water inside is no longer warm. Since flushing your sinuses with cold water is unpleasant, you will end up using the pot with more water escaping from the under the cap than from the spout.

NOT 3.5 OZ. PER BAG! Wrong info. under Product Features. It claims each bag contains 3.5 ounces. I received my box of 36 bags today, and every bag is only 2.9 ounces. So, instead of the 126 ounces claimed, they only send 104.4 ounces total. The difference is 7.44 ounces, or enough for another 7.44 bags of popcorn! It would also be nice if one could call up the Nutrition Facts of food products on Amazon - then I would have known O.R.'s Natural has 300mg of sodium per serving, compared to O.R.'s Light Butter at only 190mg of sodium/serving. Calling Natural "Simply Salted" implied to me less salt, and so I find it misleading. Posting Nutrition Facts would eliminate ambiguity and make things clear for customers.

Does NOT taste like Cashews This product is made from the Cashew fruit, not the cashew nut, so don't be expecting a delicious cashew flavored drink. This tastes more like a combination of pear and pineapple juice, with a slightly gritty texture. And despite it being packaged in the familiar cardboard-like single serving container, it has a faint canned juice taste. It isn't bad, but not something I would chose to drink.

Cherries were the pits I didn't have a problem with the taste, and I appreciate that they had no added sugar, but there were tons of pits. I was disappointed. Also, they don't stay good that long, it's a large bag that isn't re-sealable, and an invitation to bugs. Never finished them.
caffeine vomit I love the caffeine. But honestly the flavor is a bit like vomit. Can't explain it. Sour, like a sour stomach were you belch degestive juices up into your mouth.

Changes in Power Gel's Formulation Agree with the previous user / review. The new formulation is much much much saltier than the prior generation of Power Gel. Not that we don't need electrolytes during activity, but if you are thinking of this as the old style gel.... it really is not. This is more of a concentrated electrolyte drink that has very little similarity to the other products I use -- Hammer and GU.... no more branched chain amino acids and no more antioxidants. I suggest GU for great taste and all of the key ingredients for a great energy gel.

McCann's Irish Oatmeal I prefer steel-cut oats to the rolled oats. My local grocery store stopped carrying the McCann's. So I am glad to know that Amazon carries the product. McCann's is great with milk, a bit of sugar, and fresh fruit.

It's Nasty. Tastes like Pepto-Bismol I recommend buying ONE can of this somewhere FIRST to see if you like it before you buy a whole case. I read all these reviews saying this was great tasting stuff. All I have to say is- dang, I'd hate to taste the BAD stuff!! I was very surprised when I got my case of Vanilla Zoic and I couldn't gag it down. It has a very odd taste. It's a chalky-metallic, very artificial (and not in a good way) taste and it took me a while to figure out what it reminded me of- then it hit me- PEPTO BISMOL. And no, I 'm not kidding. Maybe the chocolate is better? The nutrition in this is hard to beat, but I just wish they could make it taste a little better. I have to mix fat free choc syrup into this just so I can stand it (because after all, I do have a whole case to drink!)- which sucks because it adds extra calories. Listen, I'm not a picky person... I'm a girl who eats a lot of low calorie stuff and I'm very used to this kind of thing, but this is just nasty, I'm sorry. Not a good review here. I got the recommendation from Hungry Girl and usually their reviews are spot-on, but this stuff... not so much. But hey, you may be like the others and LIKE it. If you are, then good... because you'll have a whole case to drink.

Bland These pods are rather bland. I purchased them because I thought they would make a nice dessert coffee. They do not taste much different than regular coffee pods. I would not purchase them again, nor do I recommend them.

Liked it but now its just EKKK about 2 years ago i got a sample in macys i loved it i kept going back to the store for more samples i recently bought a bottle and i guess my scent standards have matured this smells cheap to me (As it is cheaper) i would reccomend this to people who want a okay fresh scent or else just get Dunhill's fresh

Most should look elsewhere for their energy The recommended dose for these "chews" is 2 chews, which has the caffeine equivalent of 1/4 cup of coffee. But the top 2 ingredients are sugar and corn syrup. You will likely get a small boost from these, and probably not feel too bad about the sugar because they've got vitamins in 'em too. In fact, while I was hoping it'd taste like a Starbust, it instead tastes like children's vitamins. I disagree that it has a nice taste. It's tart, "vitaminy", with a somewhat unpleasant aftertaste. I'd go elsewhere for my "boost".... i.e., 3 minutes of stretching and deep breathing, perhaps!

Bold Coffee I love Donut Shop Coffee. This particular one is a little to bold for me but the flavor is great. Amazon made it easy and quick to receive my coffee. I got it in three days. Very impressive. I still drink Donut Shop coffee only in the light version.

Smells great but not worth the $ I decided to try this shampoo and conditioner because my salon is now using Bumble and Bumble products and my stylist was raving about the products. The coconut smell is great but the shampoo and conditioner are just ok. I thought that it would make my hair smooth and give it more shine, but my hair feels like I am using a cheap supermarket brand shampoo. Also, my forehead seems to be a little on the oily side since I started using these products. I normally have very dry skin with no blemishes. I am kinda disappointed because I spent $50 on both the shampoo and conditioner. I wouldn't buy these again...

Didnt' smell like the original I LOVE this cologne, however, this one seemed like it was watered down. It didn't smell the same and had a different odor throughout the day. Too bad, I was really really disappointed. I will just have to go to a department store and pick it up :(
Bland I like many of the CS teas, but this one is bland to my taste.

need more work to be better product have to open the cup and pour it in my mug because most the time it does not come out when brewed with the kcup taste is great but that is not the way it is supposed to be

very good. this soup has excellent taste,we love it,very good for a quick lunch.or just when hungry.will buy again.

great coffee great coffee and at a great price, as an added bonus you can feel good about buying it.

It is Orignal. I paid 33, and at the Duty Free it was 65. Do not doubt in buying it.
